itemLabel: David Hope, Baron Hope of Craighead

wikipedia_page.main: James Arthur David Hope, Baron Hope of Craighead,  (born 27 June 1938) is a retired Scottish judge who served as the first Deputy President of the Supreme Court of the United Kingdom from 2009 until his retirement in 2013, having previously been the Second Senior Lord of Appeal in Ordinary. He served as Convenor of the Crossbench peers in the House of Lords from 2015 to 2019.

response: *  1938   – David Hope, Baron Hope of Craighead, Scottish lieutenant and judge
